com.edugility.nomen
Class NameValue

java.lang.Object
  com.edugility.nomen.AbstractValued
      com.edugility.nomen.NameValue
All Implemented Interfaces:
Valued, Serializable
public class NameValue
extends AbstractValued

An AbstractValued implementation that represents the value of a name of something.

In the nomenclature of the Nomen project, a name is a name value that is owned by something that is named. Each concept has a corresponding class.

A NameValue may be atomic—basically a glorified String, indivisible, not subject to any further interpretation—or not atomic—in which case it is interpreted as an MVEL template that will be interpolated once the given NameValue is owned by a Name. NameValues are not atomic by default.

A NameValue may have an associated whitespace replacement String that will be used to replace any sequence of one or more consecutive whitespace characters that occur after any interpolation of a NameValue within the context of a given owner when that NameValue is not atomic.

A NameValue, once initialized with a value and an atomicity—whether via the constructor or the AbstractValued.setValue(String) and setAtomic(boolean) and setWhitespaceReplacement(String) methods—can be treated as though it is immutable. Subsequent attempts to call either the AbstractValued.setValue(String) or setAtomic(boolean) or setWhitespaceReplacement(String) methods will fail with IllegalStateExceptions.

Two NameValues are equal if their values are equal and if they are both atomic and if their whitespace replacement Strings are equal.

Design Notes

This class is designed to be treated as immutable once fully initialized. Consequently, certain methods, like setAtomic(boolean) and AbstractValued.setValue(String) and setWhitespaceReplacement(String), may only be called once with a given parameter value.

Methods and fields that might otherwise be final are explicitly left non-final so that this class may be used as a JPA entity.

Author:
Laird Nelson
See Also:
Name, AbstractValued, Named, AbstractValued.setValue(String), setAtomic(boolean), setWhitespaceReplacement(String), isInitialized(), Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

NameValue

protected NameValue()
Creates a new NameValue in an incomplete state; to fully initialize the new NameValue callers must invoke the AbstractValued.setValue(String) method, the setAtomic(boolean) method and the setWhitespaceReplacement(String) method, or must use a more suitable constructor instead.

Design Notes

This constructor exists primarily for JavaBeans, serialization and JPA compatibility. Please consider using the NameValue(String, boolean) constructor instead which fully initializes a NameValue instance as it creates it.

See Also:
NameValue(String, boolean, String), isInitialized()

NameValue

public NameValue(String value)
Creates a new NameValue that is not atomic.

This constructor calls the NameValue(String, boolean, String) constructor with false as the value for its second parameter and a single space (" ") as the value of its third parameter.

Parameters:
value - the value for this NameValue; must not be null
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if value is null
See Also:
NameValue(String, boolean, String)

NameValue

public NameValue(String value,
                 boolean atomic)
Creates a new NameValue.

This constructor calls the NameValue(String, boolean, String) constructor with the supplied atomic parameter value as the value for its second parameter and either null or a single space (" ") as the value of its third parameter, depending on whether atomic is true or not.

Parameters:
value - the value for this NameValue; must not be null
atomic - whether or not this new NameValue will be atomic
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if value is null
See Also:
NameValue(String, boolean, String)

NameValue

public NameValue(String value,
                 String whitespaceReplacement)
Creates a new NameValue.

This constructor calls the NameValue(String, boolean, String) constructor with false as the value for its second parameter and the supplied whitespaceReplacement as the value for its third parameter.

Parameters:
value - the value for this NameValue; must not be null
whitespaceReplacement - the String to be used for whitespace replacement; may be null in which case no whitespace replacement will be performed. Normally, a single space (" ") is a good value for this parameter.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if value is null
See Also:
NameValue(String, boolean, String)

NameValue

public NameValue(String value,
                 boolean atomic,
                 String whitespaceReplacement)
Creates a new NameValue.

Parameters:
value - the value for this NameValue; must not be null
atomic - the atomicity for this NameValue
whitespaceReplacement - the String to be used for whitespace replacement; may be null in which case no whitespace replacement will be performed. Normally, a single space (" ") is a good value for this parameter. If the atomic parameter value is true, then null will be used as the value of the whitespaceReplacement parameter, regardless of what value was actually supplied for it.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if value is null
See Also:
AbstractValued.AbstractValued(String), AbstractValued.setValue(String), setAtomic(boolean), setWhitespaceReplacement(String)
Method Detail

getWhitespaceReplacement

public String getWhitespaceReplacement()
Returns the String that will be used instead of consecutive occurrences of one or more whitespace characters when this NameValue's value is interpolated by a Name.

This method may return null, in which case no whitespace replacement will occur.

This method always returns null if the value of the isAtomic() method is true. Since this method calls the isAtomic() method, take care not to override that method to call this one, or an infinite loop will result.

Returns:
a whitespace replacement String, or null
See Also:
setWhitespaceReplacement(String), isAtomic()

setWhitespaceReplacement

public void setWhitespaceReplacement(String whitespaceReplacement)
Sets the String that will be used instead of consecutive occurences of one or more whitespace characters when this NameValue's value is interpolated by a Name.

If this NameValue is atomic, then the only permissible value for the whitespaceReplacement parameter is null.

Parameters:
whitespaceReplacement - the replacement String; if null then no whitespace replacement will occur
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if this NameValue is atomic and whitespaceReplacement is not null
IllegalStateException - if this method is called more than once with different values for the whitespaceReplacement parameter
See Also:
Name.getValue()

isInitialized

public boolean isInitialized()
Returns true if this NameValue is fully initialized and hence immutable.

A NameValue is fully initialized if each of its setAtomic(boolean), AbstractValued.setValue(String) and setWhitespaceReplacement(String) methods has been called, either directly or by its constructors.

Returns:
true if this NameValue is fully initialized; false in all other cases
See Also:
AbstractValued.setValue(String), setAtomic(boolean)

isAtomic

public boolean isAtomic()
Returns true if this NameValue is atomic —if it is a simple textual value and therefore not a template that must be interpolated.

This method is called by the getWhitespaceReplacement() method, so do not call the getWhitespaceReplacement() method from an override of this method, or an infinite loop will result.

Returns:
true if this NameValue is an indivisible textual value; false otherwise
See Also:
getWhitespaceReplacement()

setAtomic

public void setAtomic(boolean atomic)
Sets whether this NameValue is atomic or not—whether it is a simple textual value or is a template that must be interpolated.

This method may only be called once to set the initial value for this property. If it is called again, an IllegalStateException will be thrown.

Parameters:
atomic - whether this NameValue is atomic or not—whether it is a simple textual value or is a template that must be interpolated
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if this method is called more than once

hashCode

public int hashCode()
Returns a hashcode for this NameValue based off the return value of this NameValue's isAtomic() method, the return value of this NameValue's getWhitespaceReplacement() method and its superclass' hashcode.

Overrides:
hashCode in class AbstractValued
Returns:
a hashcode for this NameValue

equals

public boolean equals(Object other)
Returns true if the supplied Object is an instance of NameValue and returns the same value from its isAtomic() method as is returned from this NameValue's isAtomic() method and returns a value from its getWhitespaceReplacement() method that is equal to the value returned by this NameValue's getWhitespaceReplacement() method and returns a value from its AbstractValued.getValue() method that is equal to the value returned by this NameValue's AbstractValued.getValue() method.

Overrides:

Parameters:
other - the Object to compare this NameValue against for equality; may be null
Returns:
true if the supplied Object is equal to this NameValue; false otherwise
See Also:

nv

public static final NameValue nv(String value)
A convenience method for use in MVEL scripts that returns the return value of the valueOf(String) method. This method's name is shorter and hence makes such scripts slightly easier to read.

This method never returns null.

Parameters:
value - the value for which a NameValue should be returned; must not be null
Returns:
a non-null NameValue whose AbstractValued.getValue() method will return a String equal to the supplied String
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if value is null
See Also:
valueOf(String, boolean, String)

valueOf

public static final NameValue valueOf(String value)
Returns a non-null NameValue whose AbstractValued.getValue() method is guaranteed to return a non-null String that is equal to the supplied value and whose isAtomic() method will return false and whose getWhitespaceReplacement() method will return a single space (" ").

This method never returns null.

This method calls the valueOf(String, boolean, String) method with false as the second parameter value and a single space (" ") as the third parameter and returns its result.

Parameters:
value - the value for which a NameValue should be returned; must not be null
Returns:
a non-null NameValue whose AbstractValued.getValue() method will return a String equal to the supplied String and whose isAtomic() method will return a value equal to the supplied atomic parameter and whose getWhitespaceReplacement() method will return a single space (" ")
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if value is null
See Also:
valueOf(String, boolean, String)

                                      boolean atomic)
Returns a non-null NameValue whose AbstractValued.getValue() method is guaranteed to return a non-null String that is equal to the supplied value and whose isAtomic() method will return a value equal to the supplied atomic parameter and whose getWhitespaceReplacement() method will return a single space (" ").

This method never returns null.

Parameters:

IllegalArgumentException - if value is null
See Also:
valueOf(String, boolean, String)

valueOf

public static final NameValue valueOf(String value,
                                      String whitespaceReplacement)
Returns a non-null NameValue whose AbstractValued.getValue() method is guaranteed to return a non-null String that is equal to the supplied value and whose isAtomic() method will return false and whose getWhitespaceReplacement() method will return a String equal to the supplied whitespaceReplacement parameter.

This method never returns null.

Implementation Notes

This method currently invokes the relevant constructor but exists primarily to allow the possibility of some kind of caching.

Parameters:
value - the value for which a NameValue should be returned; must not be null
whitespaceReplacement - the String that will be used instead of one or more consecutive occurrences of whitespace characters in the value of this NameValue when interpolated by an owning Name; may be null in which case no whitespace replacement will occur
Returns:
a non-null NameValue whose AbstractValued.getValue() method will return a String equal to the supplied String and whose isAtomic() method will return a value equal to the supplied atomic parameter and whose getWhitespaceReplacement() method will return a String equal to the supplied whitespaceReplacement parameter
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if value is null
See Also:
valueOf(String, boolean, String)

valueOf

public static final NameValue valueOf(String value,
                                      boolean atomic,
                                      String whitespaceReplacement)
Returns a non-null NameValue whose AbstractValued.getValue() method is guaranteed to return a non-null String that is equal to the supplied value and whose isAtomic() method will return a value equal to the supplied atomic parameter.

This method never returns null.

Implementation Notes

This method currently invokes the relevant constructor but exists primarily to allow the possibility of some kind of caching.

Parameters:
value - the value for which a NameValue should be returned; must not be null
atomic - whether the NameValue returned is atomic
whitespaceReplacement - the String that will be used instead of one or more consecutive occurrences of whitespace characters in the value of this NameValue when interpolated by an owning Name; may be null in which case no whitespace replacement will occur
Returns:
a non-null NameValue whose AbstractValued.getValue() method will return a String equal to the supplied String and whose isAtomic() method will return a value equal to the supplied atomic parameter
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if value is null
See Also:
NameValue(String, boolean, String)
